page.title: 18W.THURROCK POWER STATION
page.content: West Thurrock power station is by Stoneness on the bank of the River Thames in Essex.It is about one and a half miles from Grays.It is also quite close to St. Clements church.The church is connected with the Canterbury Pilgrims.The pilgrims used to cross the Thames by ferry here. The coal which is held at West Thurrock is transported by sea from coalfields in Yorkshire and the North East.The ships have a capacity of between 4000 and 7000 tons. There are two pylons which send Electricity into the national grid.The pylons are 630 ft high and are placed one on each side of the river.They are this high to stop the ships from crashing in to them.They are also a mile apart.
